oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Percussion caps
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Percussion caps still in the paper wrapper as issued with bundles of cartridges for use with the percussion weapons of the Civil War era. The copper caps conatined mercury fulminate which created a spark when struck. The vast majority of firearms used in the Civil War required percussion caps. Every bundle of ten cartridges issued to a soldier also contained a paper tube holding twelve percussion caps.
